titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Clerical Workers Organizing Campaign Records TAM.126
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-06-10T15:55-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: New York University Clerical Workers Organizing Campaign Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: United Automobile Workers, District 65 and the Office and Professional Employees International Union, Local 153 led an unsuccessful clerical workers organizing campaign at New York University, beginning in the fall of 1969 and continuing through 1971. The collection includes printed ephemera produced by the organizing campaign and student supporters, statements and press releases by the university, picket duty material, and NLRB and SLRB documents.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: United Automobile Workers, District 65 and the Office and Professional Employees International Union, Local 153 led an unsuccessful clerical workers organizing campaign at New York University, beginning in the fall of 1969 and continuing through the strike of April/May 1970, the election of May 15, 1970, the New York State Labor Relations Board and the National Labor Relations Board decisions, and another election in 1971.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2091. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contents of the collection include: printed ephemera produced by the organizing campaign and student supporters, statements and press releases by the university, picket duty material, and NLRB and SLRB documents.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University Clerical Workers Organizing Campaign Records; TAM 126; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
